benchmark_details.name: SynDy (Synthetic Dynamic Dataset Generation)
benchmark_details.overview: SynDy is a framework for Synthetic Dynamic Dataset Generation that utilizes LLMs to create fine-grained synthetic labels for tasks relevant to misinformation mitigation, namely Claim Matching, Topical Clustering, and Claim Relationship Classification.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To improve coverage and precision of misinformation-related tasks by automatically generating datasets with synthetic labels.

data.source: Social media datasets generated through queries on platforms like Reddit.
data.annotation: Synthetic labels generated using large language models.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on benchmark datasets for claim matching and classification tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher MAP and F1 scores indicate better performance in information retrieval and classification tasks.
methodology.validation: Used pre-existing datasets to validate performance against human-labeled data.
